intro: Anchonium sterigmoides, commonly known as the African buttercup, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae and is characterized by its showy, yellow flowers with five petals. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and can be found in grasslands and along riverbanks. Its leaves are palmately divided, and it produces small, green berries that contain toxic compounds. Anchonium sterigmoides is often cultivated for its ornamental value but requires careful handling due to its potentially harmful properties.
